website_summaries.verdict: Sennheiser's HD 450BT headphones deliver excellent Bluetooth audio and solid noise cancellation for a bargain price.
pros: Strong noise cancellation for the price
Can be used in passive mode with cable, or wired mode with ANC enabled
cons: Noise cancellation is solid, but not class-leading

customer_reviews.title: Good phones. Terrible case.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: 1. Looks great 2. Excellent sound quality 3. Sound not compromised by noise cancelling function. Cons: 1. The carry case is terrible for a set in this price range. very flimsy. Not shaped or padded. offers no protection. Had to buy a third party case. This bothered me so much I removed a star. Note: Noise cancelling is focused on low frequency noise letting higher frequencies through. This is both a pro and a con depending on the situation.
customer_reviews.author: APK

customer_reviews.title: Best in class
customer_reviews.text: All in all very good, the sound quality is not quite as clear as an older aux set without noise cancelling that were far cheaper, although Bluetooth and noise cancelling is always going to add cost. Worked well on everything so far background rumbles and aircraft noise us cancelled well with only the edge taken out of people talking. Battery. Seems good haven't had it run out yet ( i usually charge it overnight every two to three days) if you don't need bt and noise cancelling theres better for a 1/3 the price by sennheiser themself. In summary it is good and is mainly about the active noise cancelling and bt than pure sound
customer_reviews.author: R-B

customer_reviews.title: Good headphones, if noise-cancellation isn't your primary need
customer_reviews.text: These headphones deliver very good, balanced sound without overdoing it on the bass or the treble. They are great choice for classical music as well. The noise cancelling feature is somewhat effective, but there are better choices on the market if that's your primary concern. While using noise cancellation, there is an audible hiss - this however gets covered up when you play music, so only an issue during very quiet periods. My main point of criticism is that these headphones are not great for people with large heads. The width is adjustable, but if you have a large head (like me), then it will be pulling up on your ears, which does get uncomfortable with prolonged listening.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Giving it one star as that is the minimum
customer_reviews.text: Terrible headphones. Not worth the money at all. I'd give them a zero star rating if that was possible. Noise cancelling is worthless, just amplifies the noise around you. Not suitable for calls (wireless mode) as they just amplify all surrounding noise. Wireless mode has a constant beep that never goes away, had them replaced once but still the same issue. LOOK FOR ALTERNATIVES and don't fall for the trap of the 450BT. Abysmal from Sennheiser.
customer_reviews.author: Bhartendu

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Having had sennheiser headphones before I was looking forward to these arriving for my wife’s birthday. Difficult sound controls, not particularly comfortable and a very flimsy case. Product returned as so disappointing. Decided to spend a little bit extra and buy her the bose qc 35’s which I have for myself. Far superior in build quality, volume controls and a much better case.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I use it wired at home so I don't have to charge batteries and so I don't know how good or bad the noise cancellation is (I think you need to be on BT for that). But the noise isolation is already great, and in my room I don't need any more. Sound quality is everything you would expect from Sennheiser, and I am wearing this thing fort hours while working and barely notice it, so it is very comfortable (if you have a head like me, at least)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: first pair of Bluetooth headphones.
customer_reviews.text: my first pair of Sennheiser's Headphones which grip head well so ok if you need to do shoelaces up etc - although they can feel a bit pinchy after an hour of wearing, sound levels and quality are ok if turned up - will suit my needs (Using on a desktop rather than bringing my inner ear wired ones)
customer_reviews.author: Mathew Palser

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, vfm noise cancelling headphones
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to replace my old Seeheiser headphones which were falling apart after many years of use. These are good mid range quality noise cancelling head phones. Comfortable and sound quality good whether using blue tooth or cable. Noise cancellation not fully ‘stress tested’ but seems pretty good and battery life seems good so far. I would say decent value for money.
customer_reviews.author: J. Tyrie

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth Transmitter Needed for Hi-Fi Receiver
customer_reviews.text: I bought these phones to use with my new Denon bluetooth capable receiver. For some technical reason the phones will not pair to the receiver, I need a separate Bluetooth Transmitter to pair the phones. Sennheiser's advertising blurb does not mention this. I bought a Transmitter, connected it to the receiver, but the headphones still do not pair up! The headband at the shortest setting does not fit my head (the phones do not fit snug, they slip down). The ear pads are too small, my ears do not fit inside comfortably. Poor design. A waste of my £130. AVOID!
customer_reviews.author: Mr S.

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the money but there are better values now.
customer_reviews.text: These were great until I ordered the Sony wh-1000mx3. Get the Sony. More money but better noise cancelling, fit, comfort and sound quality during playback. One thing about these Sennheisers though, the mic is no joke! Better than anything I’ve heard during calls, even the Sony’s (by a mile).
customer_reviews.author: IMHO

customer_reviews.title: Not for everyone
customer_reviews.text: Daughter really liked headphones - both performance and look of them. But found them uncomfortable to wear after an hour or so.
customer_reviews.author: TAI

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound quality but expected more from the product.
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the sound is amazing. When the noise cancellation is on, it really hurts my eardrums. I have to leave it off. It is also really irritating when it reminds you continually that 'there are 6 to 12 hours playtime left' every 5 minutes, muting my meetings during the process. There appears to be no way to turn this off.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Small

customer_reviews.title: aptX low latency does not work
customer_reviews.text: Using the creative bluetooth adapter BT-W3, the headphones support standard aptX and SBC, but when the adapter is toggled to aptX-LL (low latency), silence.. I have reached out to Sennheiser for comment and support. If I didn't want aptX-LL, I could have saved money and found a set of headphones that didn't support it.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Allen

customer_reviews.title: letdown
customer_reviews.text: Great overall let down by Bluetooth connection, and all function buttons on one earpiece close together
customer_reviews.author: Martin Blake

customer_reviews.title: Good sound quality, noise cancellation pretty poor and actually very uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Good sound quality for the price, however the noise cancelling is pretty poor - I actually found it quite uncomfortable, with it activated I felt a sensation of pressure inside my ears and head which has made it almost unusable for me
customer_reviews.author: Dad of 3

customer_reviews.title: They only work with Atp-x HD codec devices
customer_reviews.text: These are nice headphones with excellent sound BUT be aware they are a nightmare when it comes to pairing. They say they work with apt-x... They don't. I've tried several atp-x devices. So make sure you have devices with the newer atp-x HD Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: sara blend

customer_reviews.title: Returned immediately
customer_reviews.text: Noise cancelling didn't work at all. Sound quality very poor for the price and brand. Sent my back for a refund very quickly. Would actively recommend people to avoid these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Piers

customer_reviews.title: Quality sound let down by poor build quality.
customer_reviews.text: I really want to give these 5 stars but the build quality is poor given the price tag. Sound quality and design are good.
customer_reviews.author: Mushtaq

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: I love these, work straight out of the box, noise cancellation is lovely watching tv with the fan on in the summer, sound is excellent
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones
customer_reviews.text: Great build quality, fit well, nice sound. Do get a bit uncomfortable after a couple of hours of wearing though.
customer_reviews.author: Alec

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Hold their charge for a long period. Good quality sound. Excellent
customer_reviews.author: PETER B GOODLIFF

customer_reviews.title: The best choice! 💗
customer_reviews.text: I love my headphones. The best choice I did! Strongly recommend!💗💗💗
customer_reviews.author: Vanya Boneva

customer_reviews.title: Makes good music sound great.
customer_reviews.text: I use them almost constantly. Videogames: light on the head make gunshots sound close to realistic keeps the quality at louder volumes. Music: makes ok music sound brilliant. audiobooks: just comftable and helps me escape They don't sound like they have active noise cancelling more like passive noise cancelling, however they are excellent. 2 negatives: not the greatest controls and the microphone is not to standard good for short calls.
customer_reviews.author: teffy

customer_reviews.title: Really good for price but update ruined ANC
customer_reviews.text: Sennheiser made a high quality budget Bluetooth headphones. I've been quite happy with them for the most part: sounds great, really long battery life and the ANC was decent enough to block out constant sounds like fans. I recently updated the firmware of the headphones and the ANC is very aggressive and destroyes everything you listen to not to mention it automatically turns on every time. It's a real shame since I was really enjoying the headphones until the update.
customer_reviews.author: steeve

customer_reviews.title: Good Sennheiser deal
customer_reviews.text: Very good price for a Sennheiser headphone. Haven't used up the battery yet, great noise cancellation effect, sound quality also good.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda W

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy If You Use A PC!!!
customer_reviews.text: The Sennheiser Sound Control App is NOT AVAILABLE for computers. I will be returning these headphones as they do not meet my needs of being able to control the sound as it is advertised by Sennheiser whilst at my personal computer. Shame. And Sennheiser were very unhelpful whilst they made excuses.
customer_reviews.author: Mikelleher

customer_reviews.title: Good headphones
customer_reviews.text: Controls slightly small and difficult to locate otherwise it a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Robin K

customer_reviews.title: Screeching noise. Need a replacement.
customer_reviews.text: Need to replace this. Pretty sure it's fault as there is a screeching notice.
customer_reviews.author: Akeedah

customer_reviews.title: Very nice but a bit tight.......
customer_reviews.text: Very nice but they’re a bit tight for long time use. Very good sound reproduction. Good controls once you remember where they are. Very easy to pair with my iPhone and TV. Be aware that wireless doesn’t mean they will pair with everything that states ‘wireless’ in their descriptions - both need bluetooth, then it’s very simple
customer_reviews.author: Aremess

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant for music and Teams
customer_reviews.text: Used these in the office mostly but since lockdown they've been on my head all day for teams meetings. Work really well, clear sound and other end can hear me perfectly. Noise cancelling works well, sound quality is excellent. Please note that AS WITH ALL bluetooth headphones you need to set this to headSET (in windows) to have the mic work. In headPHONE mode mic works but you sacrifice sound quality (it's down to the bandwidth available for Bluetooth).
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: I love mine
customer_reviews.text: I have seen a lot of bad reviews for these but I have had mine over 18 months and still going strong. Sound quality is great and noise cancelling too. Only con is that the volume beeping goes a bit crazy sometimes with my iphone. I only paid £89 for these and for that price I would highly recommend, although I agree with others I probably wouldn't want to pay more than that.
customer_reviews.author: Turntablez

customer_reviews.title: Noise amplification during phone calls
customer_reviews.text: These headphones amplify ambient noise and pipe it into your ears during phone calls. I haven't found a way to turn this off. Noise cancellation is quite adequate while listening to music, I don't know why they do the exact opposite while taking phone calls.
customer_reviews.author: Conan Dalton

customer_reviews.title: Sennheiser Bluetooth headphones
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant product. Very good sound, over the ear and Bluetooth connectable. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

product_meta.title: Sennheiser HD 450BT Wireless Headphones, with active noise cancellation, White
product_meta.description:
Colour Name:WhiteStep up to great wireless sound with the HD 450BT from Sennheiser. Whether relaxing at home or on the go, they offer an exceptional combination of versatility and superior sound. 
Created by audio specialist Sennheiser to deliver a superior sound experience with deep dynamic bass, they feature active noise cancellation to ensure enjoyment without distraction. Sound quality is assured by the latest wireless technology including Bluetooth 5.0 and AAC, AptX codec support with AptX Low Latency for perfectly synchronized audio when watching videos. The Sennheiser Smart Control App makes it easy to customize the sound via the equalizer or engage podcast mode for improved intelligibility of speech content. 
A great companion for travel, the HD 450BT has a superb 30-hour battery life with fast USB-C charging, a Voice Assistant button for Siri and Google Assistant interaction, and a robust folding design for take-anywhere durability.
feature_bullets: Active noise cancellation for uninterrupted listening pleasure
Great wireless sound with deep dynamic bass and high-quality codec support including AAC and AptX Low Latency
Sennheiser Smart Control App support providing an equalizer, Podcast Mode and Firmware updates
Intuitive controls including Virtual Assistant button for Siri and Google Assistant

specifications.Delivery information:: We cannot deliver certain products outside mainland UK ( ). We will only be able to confirm if this product can be delivered to your chosen address when you enter your delivery address at checkout.
